function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Biomimetic transformation into a technical circumstance of the natural life cycle","category":"Innovation and adoption risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Bio-mimicked products and methods need analysis","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Operational limitations during an outbreak leading to inconsistent methodology and small sample size","category":"Operational and implementation risks ","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Heterogeneity of technical standards leading to obstacles in substitution between suppliers","category":"Infrastructure and connectivity risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Short lifespan of study in a quickly evolving social media ecosystem","category":"Innovation and adoption risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spatial analyses based solely on vector data models may limit the understanding of studying green spaces during a pandemic","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on gis and big data technologies for covid-19 ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Non-thermal plasma technology airphx reducing viruses, bacteria, and mold by 90-99% in the air and on surfaces","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Integration of ’contactless pathways’ to reduce covid-19 disease transmission","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased use of touchless technology and automation may lead to overreliance on these systems and neglect of manual cleaning and disinfection processes, resulting in higher transmission rates of contagious diseases.","category":"Operational and implementation risks ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High reliance on contactless systems may lead to a false sense of security and neglect of other important infection control measures, contributing to increased transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on ai for covid-19 detection and prediction","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Over-reliance on ai predictions may lead to neglect of traditional public health practices and human judgment","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Using ai algorithms to design new molecules or repurpose drugs may lead to unforeseen side effects or interactions with existing risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on ai-algorithms for identification of suspected cases and high-risk groups may lead to misclassification or false negatives.","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on ai-driven tools for accurate detection of covid-19 may lead to missed diagnoses and delayed treatment for individuals positioning, leading to reduced human oversight and interaction","category":"Artificial intelligence and machine learning risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on cross-population
